org.fluidity.deployment.plugin.spi

Interface SecurityPolicy


  • public interface SecurityPolicy
    Manage a security policy file.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  SecurityPolicy.Output
      Something where a named entry can be saved.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String JAVA_CLASS_PATH
      The system property that refers to the class path.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(File archive, int level, String location)
      Adds a new archive to include in the management of security policy.
      File archive()
      Returns the archive for which the policy is managed.
      byte[] buffer()
      Returns the I/O buffer used by the receiver.
      String name(File file)
      Returns the name of the security policy entry in the given archive.
      void save(SecurityPolicy.Output output)
      Processes all archives and saves the resulting security policy in the given output.
      void update(SecurityPolicy.Output metadata)
      Updates the the metadata based on the policy files that have been loaded.

    • Field Detail

      • JAVA_CLASS_PATH

        static final String JAVA_CLASS_PATH
        The system property that refers to the class path. Used to refer, in URLs within security policy files, to the containing archive.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name(File file)
     throws IOException
        Returns the name of the security policy entry in the given archive.
        Parameters:
        file - the archive to return the embedded security policy name from.
        Returns:
        the name of the security policy entry in the given archive; may be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O failure.

      • archive

        File archive()
        Returns the archive for which the policy is managed.
        Returns:
        the archive for which the policy is managed.

      • buffer

        byte[] buffer()
        Returns the I/O buffer used by the receiver.
        Returns:
        the I/O buffer used by the receiver.

      • add

        void add(File archive,
         int level,
         String location)
  throws IOException
        Adds a new archive to include in the management of security policy.
        Parameters:
        archive - the archive to add.
        level - the arbitrary number that can be used to order the archives within themselves.
        location - the location of the archive within the host archive.
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O failure.

      • update

        void update(SecurityPolicy.Output metadata)
     throws IOException
        Updates the the metadata based on the policy files that have been loaded. Passing null for the value of some entry will delete that entry.
        Parameters:
        metadata - the metadata to update.
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O failure.

      • save

        void save(SecurityPolicy.Output output)
   throws IOException
        Processes all archives and saves the resulting security policy in the given output.
        Parameters:
        output - the output to save the security policy.
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O failure.
